author: Omar Rashid
text:
Promoting Uttar Pradesh as the “land of unlimited opportunities,” laced with natural and human resources, Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav on Monday took a major step towards connecting and collaborating with the Indian Diaspora, in particular Non-Resident Indians of U.P. origin.

Mr. Yadav presided over the first-ever Uttar Pradesh Pravasi Diwas in Agra as part of his government’s initiative to attract NRIs hailing from the State to their roots and showcase initiatives and business potential for them. The inaugural three-day event will conclude on Wednesday.

Lauding their hard work and achievements abroad, Mr. Yadav, while addressing around 200 NRIs of prominence, said the gathering was organised to provide them an “opportunity to contribute to the development” of U.P.

The State conferred upon 16 NRIs the U.P. Apravasiya Bharatiya Ratna Puraskar for their contribution to the State’s development and extraordinary achievements in various fields or professions. The list included former Prime Minister of Trinidad and Tobago Basdeo Panday; well-known Indian-American entrepreneur-cum-philanthropist Frank Islam; and singer Alka Bhatnagar.

13 MoUs signed

To pull in investments for the State, Mr. Yadav also signed 13 MoUs in various sectors, especially in trade, investment, finance, education and technology, with major networks, including the Global Organization of People of Indian Origin. Last July, the Samajwadi Party government set up a distinct U.P. NRI department to draw in NRIs and provide them support and facilitate services for any issues they might face abroad or their kin and families at home in the State.

On Monday, Mr. Yadav dedicated the first Migrant Resource Centre to the people.
title: Akhilesh urges NRIs to invest in Uttar Pradesh
